<<<<<<< HEAD
The excellent history of the merchant of Venice VVith the extreme cruelty of Shylocke the Iew towards the saide merchant, in cutting a iust pound of his flesh. And the obtaining of Portia, by the choyse of three caskets. VVritten by VV. Shakespeare. Merchant of Venice Shakespeare, William, 1564-1616.
[80] p.
Printed by I. Roberts [i.e. by William Jaggard for Thomas Pavier], London : 1600 [i.e. 1619]
Mostly in verse. The imprint is false; actually printed in 1619 by William Jaggard for the Shakespearian collection of that year (see Greg, III, p. 1107-9). Signatures: A-K⁴. Running title reads: The comicall history of the merchant of Venice. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======

Running title reads: The comicall history of the merchant of Venice. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
